page.title: 15NATURAL HISTORY: BOWERCHALKE
page.content: WILD LIFE - About 20 Fallow and 200 roe deer roam in VERNDITCH CHASE - numbers are kept within limits. A few foreigners pay to stalk them. There are about 30 foxes controlled by the Wilton Hunt. Badgers are holding their own, but the hare population has become depleted over the last few years. Grey squirrels & rabbits are increasing. Harvest mice, wood voles, shrews and dormice abound. There are 4 varieties of cricket. Adders & grass snakes can be found in the Chase, but are decreasing. Slow worms are common in gardens, also toads, moles and hedgehogs. Glow-worms may be found on the lower slopes of Marleycombe. The longeared bat flies at dusk; the pipistrelle can be seen in woods. 200 species of moths include all the 7 hawk moths & the Lappet. Many varied butterflies appear on the Downs.
